page.title: 15TIDENHAM CHASE CHURCH
page.content: The land on which this church was built was given by the owner of Chase Farm who later became the church's first organist.She was succeeded in the post by her friend,Miss Grace, who's name has been given to the lane which leads to the otherwise isolated farms.The present organist is only the fourth holder of the post. The church,although built of stone and giving the appearance of age,is thought to be little more than a hundred years old but there is no record of when it was built or dates of past vicars.The church is of the Church of England and shares its vicar with two churches in the neighbouring area,Tidenham and Tutshill. The earliest gravestone to be found in the church is eighty years old and,as the area is so sparsely populated,burial continues.
